Package sda

Class TaskList

java.lang.Object
sda.TaskList
public class TaskList
extends java.lang.Object
This class represents TaskListing which contains the ArrayList of Task objects
Since:
2021-03-05
Version:
1.0
Author:
Hailu

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    TaskList()
    creating an TaskListing object

    A method to count the number of tasks with completed status

    A method to count the number of tasks with incomplete status

    This method will read the data file from disk which will contain the data of previously saved tasks

    A method to read the value from user (standard input, i.e., terminal) to create a Task object and to add in the ArrayList of Tasks

    A method to read the value from user (standard input, i.e., terminal) and update the given Task object in the ArrayList of Tasks

    This method will write the data of Tasks from ArrayList to data file on disk, i.e., tasks.obj

  • Constructor Details

    • TaskList

      public TaskList()
      creating an TaskListing object

  • Method Details

    • addTask

      public void addTask​(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String project, java.time.LocalDate dueDate)
      Adding a Task object in ArrayList
      Parameters:
      title - A String that holds the title of a task and it cannot be empty or null.
      project - A String that holds the name of project associated with task, and it could be an empty string.
      dueDate - The due date of the task as yyyy-mm-dd format

    • readTask

      public boolean readTask()
      A method to read the value from user (standard input, i.e., terminal) to create a Task object and to add in the ArrayList of Tasks
      Returns:
      true, if the Tasks object is created and added to ArrayList, otherwise false

    • readTaskUpdate

      public boolean readTaskUpdate​(Tasks task)
      A method to read the value from user (standard input, i.e., terminal) and update the given Task object in the ArrayList of Tasks
      Parameters:
      task - the task object whose value need to be updated with user input
      Returns:
      true, if the Tasks object is updated in ArrayList, otherwise false

    • listAllTasksByIndex

      public void listAllTasksByIndex()
      A method to display the contents of ArrayList with first column as task number

    • listAllTasks

      public void listAllTasks​(java.lang.String sortBy)
      A method to display the contents of ArrayList
      Parameters:
      sortBy - a string holding a number, "2" for sorting by project, otherwise it will sorty by date

    • editTask

      public void editTask​(java.lang.String selectedTask) throws java.lang.NullPointerException
      A method to select a particular Task object from ArrayList and perform editing operations
      Parameters:
      selectedTask - Task number that is selected by user from given list to perform editing operations
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if task number of given as empty string or null
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if task number does not fall in index range of ArrayList

    • completedCount

      public int completedCount()
      A method to count the number of tasks with completed status
      Returns:
      number of tasks with completed status

    • notCompletedCount

      public int notCompletedCount()
      A method to count the number of tasks with incomplete status
      Returns:
      number of tasks with incomplete status

    • readFromFile

      public boolean readFromFile​(java.lang.String filename)
      This method will read the data file from disk which will contain the data of previously saved tasks
      Parameters:
      filename - a string specifying the full path and extension of data file, for example, "resources/tasks.obj"
      Returns:
      true if the reading operation was successful, otherwise false

    • saveToFile

      public boolean saveToFile​(java.lang.String filename)
      This method will write the data of Tasks from ArrayList to data file on disk, i.e., tasks.obj
      Parameters:
      filename - a string specifying the full path and extension of data file, for example, "resources/tasks.obj"
      Returns:
      true if the reading operation was successful, otherwise false
